intro: Licania anneae, commonly known as the Anneae licania, is a flowering plant species native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of red and pink. Licania anneae typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to three meters. Its leaves are large, heart-shaped, and have a velvety texture, making it a distinctive and ornamental species in its native habitat.
